metadata.title: CVE-2023-44452 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Linux Mint Xreader CBT File Parsing Argument Injection Remote CodeExecution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code on affected installations of Linux Mint Xreader.User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that thetarget must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.The specific flaw exists within the parsing of CBT files. The issue resultsfrom the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before usingit to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability toexecute code in the context of the current user. Was ZDI-CAN-22132.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
